items.title: Martinez to start for Rangers on Friday vs. Angels
items.summary: The Rangers named Nick Martinez as their starter for Friday night's opener of a three-game series with the Angels. Martinez takes over for A.J. Griffin in the fifth spot in the rotation.
items.content: The Rangers named Nick Martinez as their starter for Friday night's opener of a three-game series with the Angels. Martinez takes over for A.J. Griffin in the fifth spot in the rotation.

alternate.title: Martinez to start for Rangers on Friday vs. Angels

items.title: Gyorko comes off DL ready for hitting duty
items.summary: Though he was activated from the 10-day disabled list prior to Wednesday night's game against the Reds, Cardinals third baseman Jedd Gyorko will remain limited in his availability as he continues his recovery from a right hamstring strain.
items.content: Though he was activated from the 10-day disabled list prior to Wednesday night's game against the Reds, Cardinals third baseman Jedd Gyorko will remain limited in his availability as he continues his recovery from a right hamstring strain.

alternate.title: Gyorko comes off DL ready for hitting duty

items.title: Uehara nearing return after knee infection
items.summary: Cubs reliever Koji Uehara has not pitched since Sept. 2 because of an infection in his right knee, but he threw a simulated game on Wednesday and may be able to return to action by Friday.
items.content: Cubs reliever Koji Uehara has not pitched since Sept. 2 because of an infection in his right knee, but he threw a simulated game on Wednesday and may be able to return to action by Friday.

alternate.title: Uehara nearing return after knee infection

items.title: D-backs host National Play Campaign event
items.summary: Hours before the D-backs were scheduled to face off with the Rockies on Wednesday, the outfield at Chase Field was flooded with kids sprinting, jumping and hurdling their way through a series of drills as D-backs head athletic trainer Ken Crenshaw shouted words of encouragement.
items.content: Hours before the D-backs were scheduled to face off with the Rockies on Wednesday, the outfield at Chase Field was flooded with kids sprinting, jumping and hurdling their way through a series of drills as D-backs head athletic trainer Ken Crenshaw shouted words of encouragement.

alternate.title: D-backs host National Play Campaign event

items.title: Green repays Girardi's faith with win over TB
items.summary: Chad Green's remarkable season continued, as he retired all four batters he faced, striking out three and earning the win in the Yankees' 3-2 victory over the Rays on Wednesday at Citi Field.
items.content: Chad Green's remarkable season continued, as he retired all four batters he faced, striking out three and earning the win in the Yankees' 3-2 victory over the Rays on Wednesday at Citi Field.

alternate.title: Green repays Girardi's faith with win over TB

items.title: Napoli sidelined with stress reaction in leg
items.summary: Rangers first baseman Mike Napoli has been diagnosed with a stress reaction in his lower right leg and is not in the lineup for Wednesday's game against the Mariners.
items.content: Rangers first baseman Mike Napoli has been diagnosed with a stress reaction in his lower right leg and is not in the lineup for Wednesday's game against the Mariners.

alternate.title: Napoli sidelined with stress reaction in leg

items.title: Pirela targets Friday for return to lineup
items.summary: Padres outfielder Jose Pirela remained sidelined with a sprained finger for Wednesday's series finale against the Twins at Target Field.
items.content: Padres outfielder Jose Pirela remained sidelined with a sprained finger for Wednesday's series finale against the Twins at Target Field.

alternate.title: Pirela targets Friday for return to lineup

items.title: After Minors award, Tseng earns MLB debut
items.summary: On Wednesday, Cubs manager Joe Maddon met with Jen-Ho Tseng to talk to him about being honored as the Cubs' Minor League Pitcher of the Year. Then, Maddon surprised the right-hander with some news: Tseng will make his Major League debut on Thursday.
items.content: On Wednesday, Cubs manager Joe Maddon met with Jen-Ho Tseng to talk to him about being honored as the Cubs' Minor League Pitcher of the Year. Then, Maddon surprised the right-hander with some news: Tseng will make his Major League debut on Thursday.

alternate.title: After Minors award, Tseng earns MLB debut

items.title: Storen placed on DL with right elbow strain
items.summary: The Reds placed reliever Drew Storen on the 10-day disabled list on Wednesday with a right elbow strain.
items.content: The Reds placed reliever Drew Storen on the 10-day disabled list on Wednesday with a right elbow strain.

alternate.title: Storen placed on DL with right elbow strain

items.title: Anderson's speed, D key in White Sox win
items.summary: White Sox shortstop Tim Anderson went 2-for-5 at the plate, but that wasn't the best part of his day on Wednesday at Kauffman Stadium as Chicago slipped past Kansas City, 5-3, to take two of three and win a road series for the first time since June 16-18.
items.content: White Sox shortstop Tim Anderson went 2-for-5 at the plate, but that wasn't the best part of his day on Wednesday at Kauffman Stadium as Chicago slipped past Kansas City, 5-3, to take two of three and win a road series for the first time since June 16-18.

alternate.title: Anderson's speed, D key in White Sox win
